newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Mirae ends limit-up, other IPOs mixed.
newsitem.headline: Mirae ends limit-up, other IPOs mixed.

text.p: South Korea's Mirae Corp shares finished their first day of trading 4,200 won higher at their upper limit of 74,200 won per share, the Korea Stock Exchange said on Friday.
Wooshin Industries Co Ltd also rose, gaining 2,400 won to its upper limit of 42,400 per share.
However, two other newly listed shares fell to their lower limits. Dong Won Fisheries Co Ltd lost 700 won to 12,300, and Kohap Petrochemical Corp shed 900 won to 14,100.
No Mirae shares changed hands as no holders were willing to sell, the bourse said.
The four debutants were only open for business during the morning session, to ensure that the exchange computer was not overwhelmed by orders, it added.
On the first day of LG Semicon listing on November 9, the exchange had to halt trading in the shares because the computer system was paralysed by a deluge of sell orders.
The newly listed shares will see normal trading from Monday.
